title.narrative: ED IR4.3: SOL-QUALITY PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: ED Programme Component Results (PCR) 4 IR4.3: By 2017 children in Solomon Islands including those living with disabilities in targeted areas benefit from increased enrolment and retention rates as well as from improved literacy & numeracy outcomes., which contributes to Child Protection â€“ General, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: ED Programme Component Results (PCR) 4: By 2017, an increased percentage of girls and boys access schools that uphold minimum national quality standards and support student achievement to the end of the primary cycle in at least 4 Pacific Island Countries.

description.narrative: Head teachers in selected primary schools in Solomon Islands, who have been trained by UNICEF, are now providing school-based professional development opportunities through a UNICEF-supported continuous professional development programme for teachers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/07/2017
